62980356FE4C48C190CE9F4EFB123A37.description: 2.5 Deliver presentations on problems and solutions: b. Offer persuasive evidence to validate the definition of the problem and the proposed solutions.

F1B7A9F6AC064094BE6EFA6E32FB1765.description: 2.5  Deliver presentations on problems and solutions: a. Theorize on the causes and effects of each problem and establish connections between the defined problem and at least one solution.

7199F3A0E4FF41CA9563F5706B3F25B8.description: 2.4 Deliver persuasive presentations: d. Engage the listener and foster acceptance of the proposition or proposal.

7D76A1603F4C4EFD911ADBA8536E9A7D.description: 2.4 Deliver persuasive presentations: c. Offer a logical sequence of information.

97219A7C07EB4794BB61D6EF02BC62A5.description: 2.4 Deliver persuasive presentations: b. Include relevant evidence.

925C076F6A5C42128648E44970577A79.description: 2.4  Deliver persuasive presentations: a. Provide a clear statement of the position.

10EC4EE5307F4C0EB19DE3989A8C1C42.description: 2.3 Deliver oral responses to literature: c. Develop and justify the selected interpretation through sustained use of examples and textual evidence.

5CE0AD20265F46828F95F99C4BF07CFB.description: 2.3 Deliver oral responses to literature: b. Organize the selected interpretation around several clear ideas, premises, or images.

84246AFC9D824281AA835B3F0AB20660.description: 2.3  Deliver oral responses to literature: a. Develop an interpretation exhibiting careful reading, understanding, and insight.

B93D0F2170D743FFB4E3BEB9398ED604.description: 2.2 Deliver informative presentations: b. Develop the topic with facts, details, examples, and explanations from multiple authoritative sources (e.g., speakers, periodicals, online information).

9C9F8A6C261A49D8A6526D4D6D9745DF.description: 2.2  Deliver informative presentations: a. Pose relevant questions sufficiently limited in scope to be completely and thoroughly answered.

D21D13AC388A49B4819E2D04C8C01BAC.description: 2.1 Deliver narrative presentations: c. Use a range of narrative devices (e.g., dialogue, tension, or suspense).

BC930247F9004F53AAEBA40DC7296074.description: 2.1 Deliver narrative presentations: b. Include sensory details and concrete language to develop the plot and character.

8093B04D2BBF463E9732A27D42DC0EC1.description: 2.1  Deliver narrative presentations: a. Establish a context, plot, and point of view.

E24849BCD68D41B08C4511823DA7AA3E.description: 2.0 Students deliver well-organized formal presentations employing traditional rhetorical strategies (e.g., narration, exposition, persuasion, description). Student speaking demonstrates a command of standard American English and the organizational and delivery strategies outlined in Listening and Speaking Standard 1.0.

9BA03C75A7F24958941547E0BB68E701.listId: Analysis and Evaluation of Oral and Media Communications
9BA03C75A7F24958941547E0BB68E701.description: 1.9  Identify persuasive and propaganda techniques used in television and identify false and misleading  information.

FA5887D660804D278D92260BFE1B83D9.listId: Analysis and Evaluation of Oral and Media Communications
FA5887D660804D278D92260BFE1B83D9.description: 1.8  Analyze the use of rhetorical devices (e.g., cadence, repetitive patterns, use of onomatopoeia) for  intent and effect.

4F8EBD24F0FB42858CF76C23915030EB.listId: Organization and Delivery of Oral Communication
4F8EBD24F0FB42858CF76C23915030EB.description: 1.7  Use effective rate, volume, pitch, and tone and align nonverbal elements to sustain audience  interest and attention.

8112859A8C2E44D0AAE26389EBD42846.listId: Organization and Delivery of Oral Communication
8112859A8C2E44D0AAE26389EBD42846.description: 1.6  Support opinions with detailed evidence and with visual or media displays that use appropriate  technology.

9150281DD32A4B92AFC414F20590D4A8.listId: Organization and Delivery of Oral Communication
9150281DD32A4B92AFC414F20590D4A8.description: 1.5  Emphasize salient points to assist the listener in following the main ideas and concepts.

4FE746C00A48436BBA3C7A16F6CC41DB.listId: Organization and Delivery of Oral Communication
4FE746C00A48436BBA3C7A16F6CC41DB.description: 1.4  Select a focus, an organizational structure, and a point of view, matching the purpose, message,  occasion, and vocal modulation to the audience.

34B7675CAE3E405087C37F382C5B8815.description: 1.3  Restate and execute multiple-step oral instructions and directions.

F46AF4AF5FAE4067B25F2F976168F3AA.description: 1.2  Identify the tone, mood, and emotion conveyed in the oral communication.

181FF2C67B684B5C867A929423125314.description: 1.1  Relate the speaker's verbal communication (e.g., word choice, pitch, feeling, tone) to the nonverbal  message (e.g., posture, gesture).

6B04A7BB87E9403E99C65FEF51745CB1.description: 1.0 Students deliver focused, coherent presentations that convey ideas clearly and relate to the background and interests of the audience. They evaluate the content of oral communication.

9BFCEE2CF07F48E98499AFBA1918253A.description: 1.5  Spell frequently misspelled words correctly (e.g., their, they're, there).

658F9CC959B64C9C876F7704FA4DFE39.description: 1.3  Use colons after the salutation in business letters, semicolons to connect independent clauses, and  commas when linking two clauses with a conjunction in compound sentences.

5CC60551B57D4C35B26901A20317F452.description: 1.2  Identify and properly use indefinite pronouns and present perfect, past perfect, and future perfect  verb tenses; ensure that verbs agree with compound subjects.

063BF533AB76404A8D46F0CA3D94A053.description: 1.1  Use simple, compound, and compound-complex sentences; use effective coordination and  subordination of ideas to express complete thoughts.

5E9430F2A7F7432988DB4FA977BEDA95.listId: Written and Oral English Language Conventions
5E9430F2A7F7432988DB4FA977BEDA95.description: 1.0 Students write and speak with a command of standard English conventions appropriate to this grade level.

4CA9504D6F184FF8B2FABA49CFCC4E68.listId: Using the writing strategies of grade six outlined in Writing Standard 1.0, students:
4CA9504D6F184FF8B2FABA49CFCC4E68.description: 2.3 Write research reports: b. Support the main idea or ideas with facts, details, examples, and explanations from multiple authoritative sources (e.g., speakers, periodicals, online information searches).

44C857B15B304239B74A573172592250.description: 2.3  Write research reports: a. Pose relevant questions with a scope narrow enough to be thoroughly covered.

9C717FFD9529479BA817D93805BC2F78.description: 2.2 Write expository compositions (e.g., description, explanation, comparison and contrast, problem and solution): c. Follow an organizational pattern appropriate to the type of composition.

FDD5307106F349BF93176989A4BFFB60.description: 2.2 Write expository compositions (e.g., description, explanation, comparison and contrast, problem and solution): b. Explain the situation.

2DF0E1DF31324ACFBFE0498F8EBF4785.listId: Using the writing strategies of grade six outlined in Writing Standard 1.0, students:
2DF0E1DF31324ACFBFE0498F8EBF4785.description: 2.2  Write expository compositions (e.g., description, explanation, comparison and contrast, problem and solution): a. State the thesis or purpose.

34C062EB4E2A4627878C47D2DE8B3C9C.listId: Using the writing strategies of grade six outlined in Writing Standard 1.0, students:

C495A62A68804DA99025B97A4DE0BC35.description: 2.0 Students write narrative, expository, persuasive, and descriptive texts of at least 500 to 700 words in each genre. Student writing demonstrates a command of standard American English and the research, organizational, and drafting strategies outlined in Writing Standard 1.0.

D75174E36AC7404BA8BB34EED1727F60.description: 1.6  Revise writing to improve the organization and consistency of ideas within and between  paragraphs.

4E35B81C98CC417E9FCDDD0ACFE349C0.description: 1.5  Compose documents with appropriate formatting by using word-processing skills and principles of  design (e.g., margins, tabs, spacing, columns, page orientation).

82081897BD6440B6A06F6294FDD87443.description: 1.4  Use organizational features of electronic text (e.g., bulletin boards, databases, keyword searches,  e-mail addresses) to locate information.

BB67EC0326654147B8DA3FCE0590F4EE.description: 1.3  Use a variety of effective and coherent organizational patterns, including comparison and contrast;  organization by categories; and arrangement by spatial order, order of importance, or climactic  order.

643B5EDED3174B4B999278123E5FB438.description: 1.2 Create multiple-paragraph expository compositions: c. Conclude with a detailed summary linked to the purpose of the composition.

F7BA4929066F4908B5B23CE3D10CAF41.description: 1.2 Create multiple-paragraph expository compositions: b. Develop the topic with supporting details and precise verbs, nouns, and adjectives to paint a visual image in the mind of the reader.

E6C7BF2AD6A443F2AC76B68C245EBB14.description: 1.2  Create multiple-paragraph expository compositions: a. Engage the interest of the reader and state a clear purpose.

2E70166DAD0C47158CDF3BAEF63658D8.description: 1.1  Choose the form of writing (e.g., personal letter, letter to the editor, review, poem, report, narrative)  that best suits the intended purpose.

20D6DB57563949F59BC7E394F55A4BDD.description: 1.0 Students write clear, coherent, and focused essays. The writing exhibits students' awareness of the audience and purpose. Essays contain formal introductions, supporting evidence, and conclusions. Students progress through the stages of the writing process as needed.

63AFFE459F27429894B28BD870FE08D0.description: 3.8  Critique the credibility of characterization and the degree to which a plot is contrived or realistic  (e.g., compare use of fact and fantasy in historical fiction).

5B439DA7E4DD47EEAE0363860BAB35CC.description: 3.7  Explain the effects of common literary devices (e.g., symbolism, imagery, metaphor) in a variety of  fictional and nonfictional texts.

F207F29311144B1985BFE642C5D4EFD9.description: 3.6  Identify and analyze features of themes conveyed through characters, actions, and images.

D10AB9950BE149099623373408CB05D1.description: 3.5  Identify the speaker and recognize the difference between first-and third-person narration (e.g.,  autobiography compared with biography).

D3FB941BAAD4480C8D71C953B73CAF6E.description: 3.4  Define how tone or meaning is conveyed in poetry through word choice, figurative language,  sentence structure, line length, punctuation, rhythm, repetition, and rhyme.

D136AC5BCC3B4B3494BE541ED12D30FB.description: 3.3  Analyze the influence of setting on the problem and its resolution.

BEEB975864C74706AB1F54958169F3A7.description: 3.2  Analyze the effect of the qualities of the character (e.g., courage or cowardice, ambition or  laziness) on the plot and the resolution of the conflict.

6522395167D643EE8FA5401E24D899B7.description: 3.1  Identify the forms of fiction and describe the major characteristics of each form.

D528B94220434668BFD298761DAB1706.description: 3.0 Students read and respond to historically or culturally significant works of literature that reflect and enhance their studies of history and social science. They clarify the ideas and connect them to other literary works. The selections in Recommended Literature, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve illustrate the quality and complexity of the materials to be read by students.

DC4BAE3C4DAF4DA0ACB36419B1DF006F.description: 2.8  Note instances of unsupported inferences, fallacious reasoning, persuasion, and propaganda in  text.

73F491B4CEED45F9994CA3A7ED52451B.description: 2.7  Make reasonable assertions about a text through accurate, supporting citations.

27CFFAA895FC442EA36209FD7D3F9D56.description: 2.6  Determine the adequacy and appropriateness of the evidence for an author's conclusions.

9FAF59A3D30E4F1B8EF283DE188F789E.listId: Comprehension and Analysis of Grade-Level-Appropriate Text
9FAF59A3D30E4F1B8EF283DE188F789E.description: 2.5  Follow multiple-step instructions for preparing applications (e.g., for a public library card, bank  savings account, sports club, league membership).

E5429829A9D744FAA2614C97D88DDAFB.listId: Comprehension and Analysis of Grade-Level-Appropriate Text
E5429829A9D744FAA2614C97D88DDAFB.description: 2.4  Clarify an understanding of texts by creating outlines, logical notes, summaries, or reports.

99BADB630B804939A35EFC26902367BC.listId: Comprehension and Analysis of Grade-Level-Appropriate Text
99BADB630B804939A35EFC26902367BC.description: 2.3  Connect and clarify main ideas by identifying their relationships to other sources and related topics.

F5A53A804346483B85923E56CFA7A29C.description: 2.2  Analyze text that uses the compare-and-contrast organizational pattern.

1E6AB2C304E74E629BE26748B8930DC9.description: 2.1  Identify the structural features of popular media (e.g., newspapers, magazines, online information)  and use the features to obtain information.

26782D63F238490EAF20539D44A7184A.description: 2.0 Students read and understand grade-level-appropriate material. They describe and connect the essential ideas, arguments, and perspectives of the text by using their knowledge of text structure, organization, and purpose. The selections in Recommended Literature, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve illustrate the quality and complexity of the materials to be read by students. In addition, by grade eight, students read one million words annually on their own, including a good representation of grade-level-appropriate narrative and expository text (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information). In grade six, students continue to make progress toward this goal.

2C2E46C47C1748D2B65E5212B3D6C5E7.description: 1.5  Understand and explain "shades of meaning" in related words (e.g., softly and quietly).

CA1B54C33DF943A78CA024E662B84C36.description: 1.4  Monitor expository text for unknown words or words with novel meanings by using word, sentence,  and paragraph clues to determine meaning.

949806E2FC714D3686236382D5B9562E.description: 1.3  Recognize the origins and meanings of frequently used foreign words in English and use these  words accurately in speaking and writing.

09B04612A143404FAE77C13B5A1B165D.description: 1.2  Identify and interpret figurative language and words with multiple meanings.

A1E7C68BE2624028A7219B936993BCE1.description: 1.1  Read aloud narrative and expository text fluently and accurately and with appropriate pacing,  intonation, and expression.

D675B08F31974158ADC7ECDC844D1B9D.description: 1.0 Word Analysis, Fluency, and Systematic Vocabulary Development: Students use their knowledge of word origins and word relationships, as well as historical and literary context clues, to determine the meaning of specialized vocabulary and to understand the precise meaning of grade-level-appropriate words.
